content.raw: I could be wrong, but I think a skeleton can have multiple kinematic trees that are not connected to each other so it is directly analogous to a gazebo model (perhaps with the exception of nesting). In my understanding, a `FreeGroup` can represent a connected group of links that forms a tree and where the root of the tree is connected to the world with a `FreeJoint`. A `FreeGroup` can also represent a group of other `FreeGroup`s, in which case, applying `SetWorldPose` the parent `FreeGroup` would apply the the transform to each child `FreeGroup` while making sure the relative pose between each child `FreeGroup` remains unchanged.
